intro: Eriocaulon gibbosum var. longifolium, commonly known as the long-leaved spikegrass, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Poaceae. It is characterized by its dense, spike-like inflorescence and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in wet, marshy environments, often in tropical and subtropical regions. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are usually clustered at the tips of the stems. The variety longifolium is distinguished by its elongated leaves compared to the typical form of Eriocaulon gibbosum.
